channel.title: Dementhium 639 Help
channel.description: Hello, I just switched from one dementhium source to a different one (the new one had summoning, my old one didn't ;P, and I couldn't switch it over for various code reasons) And anyways, on my old source, when a character made an account it was a .bin file, in this source its saved as a .txt file... Is there a way I can make it save games as a .bin file instead of a .txt file?

item.title: Dementhium 639 Help
item.dc:creator: @llcoolchris llcoolchris
item.description:
@llcoolchris wrote:

Yep I don’t know where this is handled since I am semi new to 639s but i believe the code you are looking for is “filereader” or the likes, it is probable handled in actionhandler.java or player.java…

But this is a big butt, converting saved game files from one server to a completely new one might not work, the way a uniqe server handles saves might be tottally different then another one. in some cases this will work with little or no issues (maybe a crash or dc which the file is being converted)

Read full topic

item.title: Dementhium 639 Help
item.dc:creator: @99rangek0 99rangek0
item.description:
